Comedies making a satirical point include the Sundance hit ""Sorry To Bother You"" in which an African-American telemarketer hits pay dirt when a co-worker gives him a bit of advice.

Spike Lee tells a true story that's more serious but has a similar starting point.
In the 1970s, African-American detective Ron Stallworth made a series of phone calls from the Colorado Springs Police Department.
Before long, he'd become a black Klansman.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""BLACKKKLANSMAN"")
(As David Duke) This is David Duke.
(As Ron Stallworth) Grand Wizard of the Ku Klux Klan - that David Duke?
(As David Duke) Last time I checked.
What can I do for?
(As Ron Stallworth) Well, since you asked, I hate blacks.
I hate Jews, Mexicans and Irish.
BlacKkKlansman"" won the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Fest, and it's one of the summer's many true-life stories.

Others include ""Gotti,"" in which John Travolta plays mob boss John Gotti, ""Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far On Foot"" with Joaquin Phoenix playing quadriplegic cartoonist John Callahan and the celebrity documentary ""Whitney"" about singer Whitney Houston.
(SOUNDBITE OF DOCUMENTARY, ""WHITNEY"")
(Singing) Show me how.
People think it's so damn easy.
Another documentary called ""Won't You Be My Neighbor?"" is about the man who said that neighborly phrase for years on TV.
(SOUNDBITE OF DOCUMENTARY, ""WON'T YOU BE MY NEIGHBOR?"")
Mr. Rogers?
(As Mr. Rogers) Yes?
I want to tell you something.
(As Mr. Rogers) What would you like to tell me?
I like you.
(As Mr. Rogers) And I like you, my dear.
Thank you very much for telling me that.

Kids feature in a very different way in another documentary ""Far From The Tree,"" a fascinating look at how families cope when children are not what their parents expect, which is the very situation Jim Parsons and Claire Danes face in a fictional context in ""A Kid Like Jake"" when they realize their 4-year-old may not have a traditional gender identity.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""A KID LIKE JAKE"")
(As Greg Wheeler) He asked why boys can't wear skirts.
(As Alex Wheeler) I don't want to send him off to kindergarten labeled.
What if he starts thinking there's something wrong with him?

A Kid Like Jake"" kicks off a virtual festival of LGBT films this summer, including the high school coming-out comedy ""Alex Strangelove,"" the conversion therapy drama ""The Miseducation Of Cameron Post"" and the music dramedy ""Hearts Beat Loud"" about a dad who wants to form a band with his lesbian daughter.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""HEARTS BEAT LOUD"")
(As Frank Fisher) When jam sesh (ph) time arrives, we have to put aside childish things like homework and med school.
(As Sam Fisher) Please don't...
In two films that have been popular at film fests, straight daughters also have dad troubles suburban-style in ""Eighth Grade""...
